item.content:encoded:
How much is SASSA child grant 2024?

Sassa has announced that the child grant has increased to R5300 for children under the age of 18.

Who qualifies for SASSA child grant?

Those who qualify for the SASSA child grant are children under the age of 18, and their parents must not be working for the government. To qualify, you need to be a South African citizen. Single parent’ yearly income can’t exceed R52,800. If you’re married, the total income for both of you shouldn’t go over R105,600 per year. Both you and your child must live in South Africa.

How to apply for SASSA child grant online

You can’t apply for the SASSA child grant online. You can only apply by visiting the nearest South African Social Security Agency (SASSA) office in your area.

  1. Here are the documents you will need to apply for the SASSA child grant.
    • Your South African ID and the childâ€™s birth certificate.
  2. They will give you the application form, which you’ll need to fill out with a SASSA worker present. Only you or a SASSA worker can fill it out.
  3. They’ll give you a receipt as proof that you applied. Keep it safe!
